# Coral Harbour Remediation Project

## Project Overview

The Government of Canada, represented by Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC), is soliciting bids for the Coral Harbour Remediation Project. This project involves the remediation of a former military base located approximately 10 km northwest of the Hamlet of Coral Harbour, Nunavut. The area was used by Canadian and American forces during the construction of the Distant Early Warning (DEW) Line during the Second World War.

## Project Description

The Coral Harbour Remediation Project includes, but is not limited to:

* Provision of equipment and materials
* Mobilization, demobilization, and logistics
* Provision of a camp and construction facilities
* Debris collection and segregation, including material processing areas
* Remediation of buried debris
* Demolition of structures and fuel storage tanks
* Hazardous material/debris management and disposal
* Non-hazardous landfill construction, operation, and closure
* Contaminated soil excavation and disposal or treatment

## Procurement Strategy

The procurement strategy for this project is a competitive select tendering process. The selection will be based on the highest responsive combined rating of Inuit Benefits Plan (IBP), technical merit, and price. This project is subject to the Directive on Government Contracts, Including Real Property Leases, in the Nunavut Settlement Area (the Nunavut Directive). The objective of the Nunavut Directive is to promote Inuit participation in business opportunities in the Nunavut Settlement Area economy.

## Bidders’ Conference

A mandatory bidders’ conference will be held on November 14, 2022, via Microsoft Teams. The conference will begin at 12:00 PM CST and will be approximately 4 hours in length. The scope of the requirement outlined in the bid solicitation will be reviewed during the conference, and questions will be answered. All bidders are required to attend, and non-attenders will be precluded from submitting a bid.
